title: DeepExplainer crashes on saved models
body:
Tensorflow originally saved models as HDF5 files, but now uses a new "SavedModel" format.  If we load a model from the HDF5 format, `DeepExplainer()/shap_values()` works fine; if we use the new format, it crashes.

Versions of stuff:
```
tensorflow==2.1.0
protobuf==3.11.3
shap==0.35.0
```

Here's minimal code to reproduce the bug:
```
import shap
import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow import keras
from tensorflow.keras import layers

# Make some data
num_features = 10
num_samples = 50
X = np.random.randn(num_samples, num_features)
y = np.random.randint(10, size=num_samples)
# Create 3 target samples to be explained
explainees = np.random.randn(3, num_features)

# Make and train minimal model
model = tf.keras.Sequential()
model.add(layers.Dense(10, activation='relu', input_shape=(num_features,)))
model.compile(optimizer='adam',
              loss=tf.losses.SparseCategoricalCrossentropy(
                  from_logits=True),
              metrics=['accuracy'])
model.fit(X, y, epochs=1, batch_size=10)

# Save model in new format
model.save('SavedModel_format')
model2 = keras.models.load_model('SavedModel_format')

# Save model in older format
model.save('HDF5_format', save_format='h5')
model3 = keras.models.load_model('HDF5_format')

# Test all the models
for m, m_str in [(model, 'Built'), (model3, 'HDF5'), (model2, 'SavedModel')]:
    try:
        explainer = shap.DeepExplainer(m, X)
        shap_values = explainer.shap_values(explainees)
        print(40 * '=')
        print('%s model worked.\n' % m_str)
    except Exception:
        print(40 * '=')
        print('%s model failed!!!!!\n' % m_str)
        raise
```

Output I get:
```
...
========================================
Built model worked.

========================================
HDF5 model worked.

========================================
SavedModel model failed!!!!!

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "minimal_example.py", line 37, in <module>
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(explainees)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/__init__.py", line 119, in shap_values
    return self.explainer.shap_values(X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, check_additivity=check_additivity)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py", line 304, in shap_values
    sample_phis = self.run(self.phi_symbolic(feature_ind), self.model_inputs, joint_input)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py", line 361, in run
    return self.execute_with_overridden_gradients(anon)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py", line 413, in execute_with_overridden_gradients
    return [v.numpy() for v in out]
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py", line 413, in <listcomp>
    return [v.numpy() for v in out]
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'numpy'
```
